document_title: Indian Emergency Response System - Crime & Natural Disaster SOPs

assign_P1_if: Acid attack in progress or just occurred
Bomb threat with device found or suspected
assign_P2_if: Aggravated assault with suspect fled (<15 minutes)

P1_resources: Ambulance service (multiple units if mass casualty)
Fire service if building fire or explosives involved
Dog squad for search and tracking if suspect fled
Bomb disposal squad if explosive threat
SWAT / Commando team for active shooter / high-risk incidents
P4_resources: Specialized unit (Cyber cell, Economic Offenses Wing) as appropriate

essential_questions: Exact location with building name, floor, room if applicable
How many suspects? Are they still on scene?
Detailed suspect description (gender, approximate age, clothing, height, build, distinguishing features)
Number of victims? Any injuries? Severity?
If suspect fled: Which direction? On foot or vehicle?
If vehicle: Type, color, registration number if visible
Are there hostages? If yes, how many?
Is caller in safe location? Where exactly?
response_protocol_steps.dispatcher_safety_check: Ensure caller is in safe location and speaking freely (not under duress)

dispatch_sequence: Dispatch nearest patrol units IMMEDIATELY - minimum 2 units for P1
Alert QRT / armed police for P1 violent crimes
Dispatch ambulance (multiple units if mass casualties reported)
Notify senior officers (Station House Officer, DCP) for P1 situations
If hostage / active shooter - alert SWAT/commando unit immediately
If bomb threat - alert bomb disposal squad and fire service
Coordinate with neighboring police stations for area saturation
If suspect vehicle described - alert all mobile units and PCR vans with BOLO (Be On Lookout)
response_protocol_steps.communication_protocol: Use standardized police codes. Provide: Location, Crime type, Suspect description, Weapon type, Officer safety concerns

if_violence_ongoing: If safe to leave: EVACUATE IMMEDIATELY. Get to safe location away from scene.
Do NOT confront suspect or intervene unless life is in immediate danger and no other option
If cannot escape: HIDE. Lock doors, turn off lights, silence mobile phone, stay away from windows
If hiding: Stay on line but remain quiet. Listen to dispatcher instructions
If must engage to save life: Target vulnerable areas (eyes, throat, groin), use any object as weapon, fight with maximum aggression, escape as soon as possible
if_suspect_fled: Do NOT pursue suspect - leave to police
Do NOT touch anything at scene - preserve evidence
Clear area and prevent others from entering
Note exact direction suspect fled, any vehicle details
Render first aid to victims if trained and safe to do so
Keep witnesses together for police statements
if_hostage_situation: Provide any information about hostages (number, identities, condition)
If you are hostage: Stay calm, comply with demands, don't make sudden movements, wait for police

first_unit_on_scene: Assess scene from safe distance - do not rush in blindly
Establish INNER perimeter (minimum 100m for P1, 50m for P2)
Identify all entry and exit points to scene
Set up Command Post at safe location outside perimeter
Begin evacuation of civilians from danger zone
Prevent entry of unauthorized persons including media
Identify safe approach routes for additional units
response_protocol_steps.communication: First officer on scene becomes initial IC (Incident Commander) until relieved by senior officer

active_shooter_protocol.priority: STOP THE KILLING - immediate action required
tactics: Form immediate action team (3-4 officers)
Rapid deployment to neutralize threat
Bypass injured victims initially (rescue team follows)
Move toward sound of gunfire
Engage shooter with overwhelming force
Isolate, contain, neutralize
Establish tight perimeter - suspect cannot escape
Cut off utilities if safe (power, gas, phone)
Deploy negotiator - establish communication
SWAT team prepares for tactical entry if needed
Patience - time is on police side in barricaded situation
DO NOT make entry unless hostages being actively killed
Establish negotiation - buy time
Gather intelligence (building layout, number of hostages, hostage taker profile)
SWAT team prepares rescue options
Only breach if imminent threat to hostage life

victim_care: Once scene is secure, medical care is priority
Triage victims: Immediate (red), Delayed (yellow), Minor (green), Deceased (black)
Allow ambulances to enter for evacuation
Secure separate area for victim statements when stable
Arrange victim support services (counseling, legal aid)
Notify family members through appropriate channels
evidence_preservation: Secure crime scene with barrier tape
Document scene with photography before disturbance
Prevent contamination - limit personnel in scene
Collect physical evidence (weapons, casings, blood, fibers)
Document chain of custody for all evidence
response_protocol_steps.forensic_team: Call forensic specialists for detailed evidence collection once scene is secured

apprehension: If suspect fled: Issue lookout notice with description
Check CCTV in area for suspect movement
Set up checkpoints on likely escape routes
Coordinate with railway/bus stations if suspect may flee city
Issue warrant for arrest once identity established
arrest_protocol: Inform of arrest and rights (right to remain silent, right to lawyer)
Transport to police station in secure vehicle
Medical examination of suspect (document any injuries)
interrogation: No coercion or torture (unconstitutional and inadmissible)
Document confession properly for court admissibility
Collect forensic evidence (fingerprints, DNA, GSR test for firearms)

investigation_checklist: Interview all witnesses - record statements under CrPC Section 161
Prepare site plan / crime scene sketch
Collect forensic reports (ballistics, fingerprints, DNA, toxicology)
Obtain CCTV footage from all nearby cameras
Track suspect's mobile phone location data (with court order)
Prepare charge sheet within statutory time limit (60-90 days depending on offense)

escalation_triggers.action: Declare major incident, request all available units, activate mutual aid from neighboring districts
escalation_triggers.notification: Police Commissioner, Home Department, Hospital mass casualty alert, Media cell

escalation_triggers.action: Escalate to National Security Guard (NSG) if available in city, or elite state commando unit
escalation_triggers.notification: Director General of Police, Home Secretary, NSG operations

escalation_triggers.action: Immediate backup, secure officer and evacuate to hospital, manhunt for suspect
escalation_triggers.notification: All units, senior command, media blackout until family notified

escalation_triggers.action: Evacuate 500m radius, bomb disposal squad, fire service standby
escalation_triggers.notification: District Magistrate, NSG bomb disposal, NDRF

escalation_triggers.action: Deploy rapid action force, prohibitory orders (Section 144), preventive detentions
escalation_triggers.notification: District Magistrate, Home Department, Central forces if needed

india_specific_considerations.context: India has seen incidents of mob violence including lynchings based on rumors (often spread via WhatsApp)
india_specific_considerations.police_response: Rapid deployment to prevent mob formation, use of non-lethal crowd control (lathi charge, tear gas), arrest ringleaders, social media monitoring to counter rumors, community policing to build trust

india_specific_considerations.context: Religious tensions can escalate quickly, especially during festivals or after provocative incidents
india_specific_considerations.preventive_measures: Intelligence gathering, community liaison officers, peace committees, prohibitory orders, flag marches, rumor control cells

india_specific_considerations.challenge: Domestic violence is underreported. Dowry-related violence can be fatal.
india_specific_considerations.protocol: Mandatory arrest in domestic violence cases with evidence, women police officers for sensitive cases, link to women helpline 181/1091, shelter homes, legal aid for victims

india_specific_considerations.challenge: India has high rates of acid attacks, mostly on women
india_specific_considerations.immediate_response: Rush victim to hospital - continuous water irrigation for 15-20 minutes, alert plastic surgery / burns unit, register FIR immediately (IPC 326A), counsel victim about compensation schemes, track acid sale regulation compliance

india_specific_considerations.approach: Proactive protection for couples at risk (who report threats), fast-track trials, counseling for families, publicize punishments to deter

india_specific_considerations.rising_threat: Financial frauds, morphing, online harassment, sextortion
india_specific_considerations.specialized_response: Cyber crime cells in each state, portal www.cybercrime.gov.in, coordination with tech companies, digital forensics, awareness campaigns

assign_P1_if: Persons stranded on rooftops or trees
assign_P2_if: Gradual flooding with time to evacuate
Water entering homes but not immediately life-threatening

P1_resources: NDRF / SDRF teams with boats and rescue equipment
Helicopters for aerial rescue if available

warning_system: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issues flood warnings
Central Water Commission monitors river levels
District administration disseminates warnings via SMS, TV, radio, sirens
evacuation_protocol: Identify low-lying areas and populations at risk
Open relief camps / shelters in safe areas (schools, community halls)
Evacuate vulnerable first (elderly, disabled, children, pregnant women)

rescue_tactics: Deploy NDRF/SDRF teams with inflatable boats
Rescue stranded persons from rooftops - aerial if possible
Vehicle occupants - break windows if needed for extraction
Swift water rescue techniques for flowing water
Mark rescued locations to avoid duplication
response_protocol_steps.safety: Rescuer safety paramount - use life jackets, helmets, work in teams, do not enter water that is too deep or fast

camp_requirements: Separate spaces for women and families
response_protocol_steps.health_concerns: Prevent waterborne diseases (cholera, typhoid, diarrhea) through clean water, hygiene, vaccination. Monitor for vector-borne diseases (malaria, dengue).

response_protocol_steps.compensation: State government provides financial assistance for house damage, crop loss, livestock loss, livelihood support as per SDRF norms

india_specific_flood_zones.monsoon_floods: Annual phenomenon affecting Assam, Bihar, UP, West Bengal, Kerala during June-September. Brahmaputra and Ganga basin flooding. Preparedness and early warning systems critical.
india_specific_flood_zones.flash_floods: Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh - cloudburst and glacial lake outburst floods (GLOFs). Very rapid onset, high casualties. Need real-time monitoring and quick response.
india_specific_flood_zones.urban_flooding: Mumbai, Chennai, Bangalore, Hyderabad - poor drainage, encroachment of water bodies, heavy rainfall causes waterlogging. Need urban flood management plans.
india_specific_flood_zones.coastal_flooding: Cyclone-induced storm surge in Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal. Integrated with cyclone preparedness.

priority_determination.all_earthquakes_above_magnitude_5: Automatic P1 - Major disaster protocol activation

immediate_response_protocol.phase: During Earthquake (if personnel on duty experience it)
immediate_response_protocol.instructions: Get under sturdy table/desk, protect head, stay away from windows, do NOT run outside during shaking

steps: Deploy all available police, fire, civil defense
Request NDRF teams (9 regional hubs across India)
Alert Indian Army (Army has 225 HADR-trained teams)
Assess critical infrastructure damage (dams, nuclear plants, bridges)

tactics: Systematic area search - grid pattern
Mark buildings searched (Orange X = searched, body count)
Use search dogs to locate survivors in rubble
Breaching and shoring techniques to reach victims
Medical care during extrication (crush syndrome treatment)
Priority to structures most likely to have survivors (hospitals, schools, residential)
immediate_response_protocol.golden_window: First 24-48 hours critical for survival. After 72 hours, survival rate drops dramatically.

india_specific_seismic_zones.Zone_V_Very_High_Risk: Kashmir, Western Himalayas, Northeast India, Kutch (Gujarat), Andaman & Nicobar
india_specific_seismic_zones.Zone_IV_High_Risk: NCR Delhi, Jammu, Himachal, Uttarakhand, Bihar, UP-Nepal border
india_specific_seismic_zones.preparedness: Building codes (IS 1893, IS 4326) mandatory but often not enforced. Retrofit of old buildings needed. Public awareness and earthquake drills essential.

72_hours_before: District administration activates cyclone preparedness committees
Pre-position NDRF teams in vulnerable districts
Stock relief materials (tarpaulin, food, water, medicines)
Alert fishing community - boats to harbor, no fishing
48_hours_before: Evacuate coastal villages in high-risk areas
Close schools and offices in affected districts
Tie down loose objects, board up windows
24_hours_before: Cut power supply in coastal areas (prevent electrocution)
Deploy response teams in safe locations ready to move
Last chance to stock essential supplies
during_cyclone: Do NOT venture out (wind, flying debris, storm surge)
Response teams standby - can't operate during peak
after_cyclone_passage: Assess damage - aerial survey if possible
Search and rescue for any casualties

india_cyclone_context.frequency: Annual phenomenon - Bay of Bengal (April-May, October-November) and Arabian Sea (May-June)
india_cyclone_context.vulnerable_states: Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Gujarat
india_cyclone_context.improvements: India's cyclone early warning and evacuation has dramatically improved. Zero casualty missions possible (Cyclone Fani 2019 - evacuated 1.2 million people)
india_cyclone_context.key_assets: NDRF, Coast Guard, Navy, State disaster response forces, Cyclone Warning Division IMD

disaster_management_framework.national_level: National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) - PM chairs
disaster_management_framework.state_level: State Disaster Management Authority (SDMA) - CM chairs
disaster_management_framework.district_level: District Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) - District Magistrate/Collector chairs

response_forces.NDRF: National Disaster Response Force - 12 battalions, specialized CBRN, USAR, water rescue
response_forces.SDRF: State Disaster Response Force - in each state, modeled on NDRF
response_forces.Army: Provides massive manpower and logistics in major disasters
response_forces.NGOs: Many NGOs active in disaster relief

financial_mechanism.SDRF: State Disaster Response Fund - for immediate relief
financial_mechanism.NDRF: National Disaster Response Fund - for calamities of severe nature
